intro: Acrotome pallescens, commonly known as the pale acrotome, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fabaceae. It is native to certain regions of South America, particularly in Argentina and Bolivia. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, pale green leaves. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, often appearing in shades of white or pale yellow. Acrotome pallescens is adapted to arid environments and is often found in open grasslands or rocky areas.
